Hello! Yeah, you!
Could you buy me a beer?
I forgot my wallet at home.
story-chapter-2-1:
Ooh! Still some hope for mankind!
Cheers!

What if I gave you a short story in return?
story-chapter-2--1:

Jill, put another one on my tab, please.
Thank you, sweetheart!
Now... Could I enlighten you with one of my many stories to make the thought of being generous go away?
story-chapter-3-2:
Wow! You are a generous one and a great listener
The world is for sure a better place with you, thank you.
story-chapter-3-0:
Great, whether you are a great listener or just generous.
I'm thankful to have you.
These days people like you are hard to find.
story-chapter-3--2:
May I ask why you came to a pub
Be social! Fill the belies of lost cases like me and listen to their sad stories.

story-chapter-4:
So... Let me tell you a story about this simple plain beer here.
This is the brew of history.
It was brewed for kings, queens, for their people and their swords and sorrows.
Even entire civilizations were calmed by it.

Oh! Before I continue, what is your name?
story-chapter-5:
{playerName}, Ehj? That's a fine name.
It reminds me {randomFact}. *BURP*

Is that a name for a girl or a boy?
Sorry but my manners are getting rustier every day.
Tell my wife that you can't teach an old dog new tricks.
story-chapter-6:
I'm Maurits. What's in the past, is in the past but I was once a great writer instead of a renowned drinker.
My stories were legendary and were told everywhere.
Even many sons were named to me, no joke.

In the end... Everything has its price.
I could have any girl I wanted but the one person... Got away.

She was destined to be mine, at least that was what I thought and still think.
We got married and started a family.
Years went by and we were happy.

Then one night... I lost it all.
I wasn't home because I was on a quest for a story.
A fire started by marauders caused the death of my very existence.
My home, my family, my wife... Gone.

When I came back, I was too devastated to stay in my hometown.
I couldn't bear the thought, the memories...

Ever since... You can find me in places like this.

Even though I wish I could go back...

Where would you like to be
story-chapter-7:
{placeName}? I never heard of it.
Sounds nice!

Well... Let us get back to the story I was going to tell you.

500 years ago, there was once an abbey on the foot of the hill in a place called {placeName} .
The place wasn.t important to anything or to anyone.
It wasn't beautiful nor rich nor famous for people to go there.
Even the people living there didn't care about what happened to their home.

They had a job to attend to, shared a nice meal every evening with their families
and that was what got them through the day.
{fatherName} was the brewer of {placeName}, he and his beer were famous.
Sadly, his beer didn't make him immortal and he just died when {playerName}, his only {daughterSon} was born.

People forgot the once dearly known brewer and the taste of his legacy.

Years go by and little {playerName} grows older.
One day {sheHe} finds a book on a dusty shelf.
It was a journal of {herHis} father {sheHe} only knows by memories told by people.
The journal told about the fame and glory of {fatherName} brews and even a little clue about a recipe he hid from the world when he knew his last day would come.

After {playerName} discovered this, {sheHe} was intrigued by his tale asked Mother to tell more.

She confirmed everything like a caught murderer confesses his crimes
but she didn't know anything about the secret recipe and where it could be hidden.

She only knew that her husband spent a lot of time in the silent abbey located in the mountains.

"Maybe the recipe is hidden within the abbey?" {playerName} wondered.

The next morning {sheHe} packed {herHis} bags and left home determined to find the abbey.

After buying some supplies on the marketplace, {sheHe} started to head out to the border of centre of {placeName}.
The path within the mountains was steep and even a bit dangerous because of snow that hid the steps.
With every step {sheHe} took, {herHis} heartbeat went up a little.

The walk takes a half a day if I remember correctly.

The first looks were a little bit frightening.
Moss covered the big beams which hold the big wooden gate.
Water of a little creek runs under the drawbridge.

After grasping the moment of arriving to the moment of truth, {playerName} heard the gate opening.
A man approached.

Timid as he was, he said: 'Welcome traveller. What brings you here?
Before the {girlBoy} could say anything, the man had a better look at the unexpected visitor.
'It's you! You are the {daugtherSon} of {fatherName} said the man.
'I'm abbot {abbotName}, your father was a great friend. Come in! It's not safe at night here.
Wolves are always lurking for our chickens.

So, the {girlBoy} follows the abbot inside.
As the path leads the way to the abbey, the gate closes silently behind them.

'You want to know more about your father, correct?': said the abbot.
{playerName} nodded.

The big door opened of the abbey when they arrived the main hall of the building.
Fumes of a fireplace and its light escaped through the entrance.

After a humble dinner together with the other monks.
{playerName} was given a small bedroom.

Before the abbot left of to his own room, he said: Tomorrow I'll tell you the story of your father and I.'

{sheHe} couldn't sleep that night.
It could be the night where a whole part of {herHis} life.
story-chapter-8:
Your father and I had some common interests, the abbot told.
'I had a small stall with spices, potions and other trinkets on the market of {placeName}.
That is 20 years ago.

Your father sought me out, like I picked rosemary in the forest.
He said he needed knowledge about some herbs.
I asked him why. And he said he was experimenting to find a new way of brewing.
{fatherName} wanted to brew a beer worth fighting for, a beer that wields power, making a difference in the world.

I was just an young monk in the abbey, with somewhat experience in botanology
but I felt like I had to help him. So, I did.

We reorganized the inner garden of the abbey. Sat together for hours in dozens of nights, just to find the right ingredient for the beer that would make such a difference.
The brewery you can find here, was also built in those days. We transformed together with my brothers this abbey into a true brewery, capable of doing anything.

Even though... Months went by, we had hundreds of failed batches, maybe even more and we still didn't make what satisfied our expectations.

Until one day, a smell came out of the brewery's chimney.
The clouded sky opened, the sun started to shine upon the claystone of courtyard where we were sitting.
Apparently, the smell got carried away with the wind into the centre of {placeName}.

Suddenly a lot of people from the centre came to visit our humble abbey to ask where that smell came from.
We both saw what happened, we may have found the recipe that your father was looking for.

That night we celebrated. We made it.
Finally, our prayers were answered, our demands were heard and filled.

We wrote the recipe down, we put a scheme together of all the steps we took to make the beer.
I insisted that your father would be the sole owner of the recipe.
Even though I trusted every brother in my abbey with my life, this was more important.

After 4 days, a man approached the abbey.
He said he was a servant of the king himself.
It appeared that the king's nose caught the smell as well.
The king demanded that we could brew this beer for him and only for him.

In that way he could overrule his opponents in battles.

We didn't believe that the beer could such a power.
In any case, we weren't eager to accept such a deal because we were afraid that such a power, if our brew would give such a power, could have a bad outcome.

After we told the man, we couldn't cooperate with them, your father headed immediately for the forest to hide the recipe there.

We decided that such a secret could be dangerous.
Doesn,'t matter the recipe was used in the future nor in the past.
It would be the secret of the mountains, your father said when he came back.

1 day later, your father said goodbye.
He had received a letter from your mother, telling him that he got a {daugtherSon}.

Word got out that when he wanted to enter {placeName}. Some guards of the palace were waiting for him.
They took him out and your father was never to be heard of again.
story-chapter-9-1: Thank you, it is one of my most treasured stories I ever came up with.
story-chapter-10:
Well... It was nice meeting you here.
Until next time, I have some work to attend to.
Tomorrow is another work day on the market.
